verses.roman:
ripavo jigyur adhunā
kāla ātmānusāriṇi
tadā vayaṁ vijeṣyāmo
yadā kālaḥ pradakṣiṇaḥ

synonyms: ripavaḥ—our enemies; jigyuḥ—have conquered; adhunā—now; kāle—the time; ātma—them; anusārīṇi—favoring; tadā—then; vayam—we; vijeṣyāmaḥ—shall conquer; yadā—when; kālaḥ—time; pradakṣiṇaḥ—turned toward us.
translation: Now our enemies have conquered because time favors them, but in the future, when time is auspicious for us, we shall conquer.
